definition: classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc

sentences.english: So everyone can roll in fornication?
Now he accused Victor of adultery .
sentences.chinese: 現在他以通姦罪控告維克多。

sentences.english: Discussions of marriage cannot avoid topics such as impotence and adultery.
sentences.chinese: 討論婚姻不可能避開性無能和通姦這樣的題目。

sentences.english: It was proved that his wife had misconducted herself with several men.
sentences.chinese: 他太太被證實曾與幾個男人通姦。
由於誘惑所犯的通姦罪。

sentences.english: Fornication is a crime in some American states.
sentences.chinese: 在美國的一些州，通姦屬於犯罪。

sentences.english: The laws on fornication have historically been tied up with religions.
sentences.chinese: 通姦的法條在歷史上一直都跟宗教脫不了關係。

sentences.english: It seems that the religion that seeks to stop fornication is only known to Muslims.
sentences.chinese: 看起來要求停止通姦的宗教只有穆斯林才知道了。

sentences.english: Abdullah didn’t want to be stoned for participating in adultery, did he?
sentences.chinese: 阿卜杜拉不想因爲通姦而被石頭砸死，是吧？

sentences.english: Then in 1536, the king had Anne beheaded on a charge of adultery.
sentences.chinese: 而後1536年，亨利以通姦罪將安妮斬首。

sentences.english: If you have been cheating on your spouse , you are being an adulterer .
sentences.chinese: 如果您已被作弊就您的配偶，你是作爲一個通姦者。

sentences.english: I just wanted to avoid adultery.
sentences.chinese: 我只是不想背著你犯下通姦罪。

sentences.english: In the Samyutta Nikaya he uses this principle to advise against adultery.
sentences.chinese: 在南傳大藏經之中，這條原則被用來批判通姦。

sentences.english: A young man accused of adultery was driven into self-exile.
sentences.chinese: 一個年輕男子通姦被告成自我放逐驅動。

sentences.english: Luxury shall overspread the land, and fornication shall not cease to debauch mankind.
sentences.chinese: 奢侈會蔓延整塊陸地，通姦不會被制止，使人類墮落。

definition: lit. kept inside a drum (idiom)/fig. completely in the dark
to see with one's own eyes/to witness
to entrap/to frame/to plant false evidence against sb
to lament/to complain tearfully/to wail accusingly
to order the arrest of sb as criminal/to list as wanted
